googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsSdr: Bring your North Carolina driver's license or state ID card with you. If you don't have one, bring ONE photo ID that shows your name, and ONE document that shows your name and current address.  Acceptable documents include a utility bill, bank statement, paycheck, residential lease, or any government document that shows your name and address.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfBox6: Enter North Carolina driver’s license number.  If you don't have a driver’s license, enter the last 4 digits of your social security number. If you don't have either number, write "NONE" in the box.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.vbmAbsenteeBallotRules: Any registered North Carolina voter may request an absentee ballot and vote by mail.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfSubmissionAddress:
State Board of Elections  
P.O. Box 27255  
Raleigh, NC 27611‐7255
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsInPersonVoting: Most North Carolina voters don't need to show ID at the polls.  First time North Carolina voters should be prepared to show ID.  Acceptable forms of photo-ID include a non-expired drivers license from any state, a military ID, a student ID, a US passport, or any other government issued photo ID.  Acceptable forms of non-photo ID include a current utility bill, bank statement, pay statement, car registration, rent receipt, government check, or other government document that shows your name and North Carolina address.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.vbmWarnings: **Your voted ballot must be signed by a witness or it will not be counted.  **
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.year2020LegalChanges: Due to COVID-19, North Carolina citizens who vote by mail will need only one witness signature instead of two on their voted ballots.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfBox7: You must register with a party to vote in that party’s primary unless that party allows unaffiliated voters to vote in its primary. If you indicate a political party that is not a qualified party, or indicate no party, you will be listed as “Unaffiliated”.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsOvr: You can register to vote online if you have a North Carolina Driver License or DMV-Issued ID Card Number.  If not, you can still register to vote by mail or in person.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfBox8: You are required to fill in this box. However, your application will not be rejected if you fail to do so.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsVbm:
* In 2020, you need to have your voted absentee ballot signed by one witness.
* In general, you need to have your voted absentee ballot signed by two witnesses
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationRules:
To register in North Carolina you must:

  * be a citizen of the United States
  * be a resident of North Carolina and the precinct in which you live for at least 30 days prior to Election Day
  * be 18 years of age by the day of the next general election
  * have your rights of citizenship restored if you have been convicted of a felony
  * not be registered or vote in any other county or state
